Module net.automatalib.util
Package net.automatalib.util.automaton.minimizer

Class HopcroftMinimizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.automatalib.util.automaton.minimizer.HopcroftMinimizer
  • public final class HopcroftMinimizer
extends Object
    Hopcroft's minimization algorithm for deterministic finite automata.

    Hopcroft's algorithm solves the functional coarsest partition problem for finite automata in running time O(nk log n), where n is the size of the input DFA and k the size of the input alphabet.

    Important note: Hopcroft's minimization algorithm works for complete automata only. If the automaton is partial, you may use the minimizePartial... utility methods that automatically add a sink state when encountering an undefined transitions. If you have very sparse automata, Minimizer may yield better performance.

    Note that the partition refinement step only calculates classes of equivalent states. However, minimization also requires pruning of states that cannot be reached from the initial state. Most methods in this class support a variable of type PruningMode that controls if and when pruning is performed: if the automaton to be minimized is known to be initially connected (i.e., it contains no unreachable states), pruning can be omitted completely (by specifying PruningMode.DONT_PRUNE) without impairing correctness. Otherwise, pruning can be chosen to be performed on the automaton to be minimized (PruningMode.PRUNE_BEFORE), or on the calculated state partition (PruningMode.PRUNE_AFTER). Note that using PruningMode.PRUNE_BEFORE with the minimizePartial... methods may result in the artificial sink state being included in the final automaton. For methods that do not provide a pruningMode parameter, the default is PruningMode.PRUNE_AFTER.

    • Method Detail

      • minimizeDFA

        public static <I,​A extends DFA<?,​I> & InputAlphabetHolder<I>> CompactDFA<I> minimizeDFA​(A dfa)
        Minimizes the given, complete DFA. The result is returned in the form of a CompactDFA, using the input alphabet obtained via InputAlphabetHolder.getInputAlphabet(). Pruning is performed after computing state equivalences.
        Type Parameters:
        I - input symbol type
        A - automaton type
        Parameters:
        dfa - the DFA to minimize
        Returns:
        a minimized version of the specified DFA

      • minimizeDFA

        public static <I> CompactDFA<I> minimizeDFA​(DFA<?,​I> dfa,
                                            Alphabet<I> alphabet)
        Minimizes the given, complete DFA. The result is returned in the form of a CompactDFA, and pruning is performed after computing state equivalences.
        Type Parameters:
        I - input symbol type
        Parameters:
        dfa - the DFA to minimize
        alphabet - the input alphabet (this will be the input alphabet of the returned DFA)
        Returns:
        a minimized version of the specified DFA

        Minimizes the given, complete DFA. The result is returned in the form of the automaton created by the given creator.

      • minimizeUniversal

        public static <I,​SP,​TP,​A extends MutableDeterministic<?,​I,​?,​SP,​TP>> A minimizeUniversal​(UniversalDeterministicAutomaton<?,​I,​?,​SP,​TP> automaton,

      • minimizePartialUniversal

        public static <I,​SP,​TP> UniversalCompactDet<I,​SP,​TP> minimizePartialUniversal​(UniversalDeterministicAutomaton<?,​I,​?,​SP,​TP> automaton,
                                                                                                      Alphabet<I> alphabet,
                                                                                                      PruningMode pruningMode,
                                                                                                      AutomatonInitialPartitioning ip,
                                                                                                      Object sinkClassification)
        Minimizes the given, potentially partial automaton depending on the given partitioning function.
        Type Parameters:
        I - input symbol type
        SP - state property type
        TP - transition property type
        Parameters:
        automaton - the automaton to minimize
        alphabet - the input alphabet (this will be the input alphabet of the resulting Mealy machine)
        pruningMode - the pruning mode
        ip - the initial partitioning function, determining how states will be distinguished
        sinkClassification - the signature identifying the artificial sink state
        Returns:
        the minimized automaton, initially constructed from the given creator.

      • minimizePartialUniversal

        public static <I,​SP,​TP,​A extends MutableDeterministic<?,​I,​?,​SP,​TP>> A minimizePartialUniversal​(UniversalDeterministicAutomaton<?,​I,​?,​SP,​TP> automaton,
                                                                                                                                         Alphabet<I> alphabet,
                                                                                                                                         PruningMode pruningMode,
                                                                                                                                         AutomatonInitialPartitioning ip,
                                                                                                                                         Object sinkClassification,
                                                                                                                                         AutomatonCreator<A,​I> creator)
        Minimizes the given, potentially partial automaton depending on the given partitioning function. The result is returned in the form of the automaton created by the given creator.
        Type Parameters:
        I - input symbol type
        SP - state property type
        TP - transition property type
        A - automaton type
        Parameters:
        automaton - the automaton to minimize
        alphabet - the input alphabet (this will be the input alphabet of the resulting Mealy machine)
        pruningMode - the pruning mode
        ip - the initial partitioning function, determining how states will be distinguished
        sinkClassification - the signature identifying the artificial sink state
        creator - the creator for constructing the automata instance to return
        Returns:
        the minimized automaton, initially constructed from the given creator.
